alert.note: Alert for DuPage; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 2:20PM CST until February 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Illinois... East Branch Du Page River at Bolingbrook affecting Will and DuPage Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall on frozen ground is expected. * WHERE...East Branch Du Page River from Maple Avenue in Lisle downstream to confluence with West Branch DuPage River, including the Bolingbrook gauge. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Low-lying areas of the DuPage River Greenway are inundated along the river near Royce Road in Bolingbrook. Low-lying property inundated at the Royce Road Water Reclamation Facility in Bolingbrook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:40 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest near 18.5 late tonight. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected tonight.
